title: Password Complexity Not Enforced On Password Change

profile.name: ownCloud
profile.about: ownCloud GmbH is the company behind the ownCloud Project - the most downloaded open source project for data and file sync, share and view.

vulnerability_information:
Hi!

Owncloud does not enforce password complexity on password change, so it's possible to use passwords of any size or form. 

In example I can set my password to be "a" or "qwerty".

__________________________________________________________________
How to reproduce:
Change your password to something that does not match your required complexity.
__________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________
Proof Of Concept:
Login with my dummy account
account --> "testingdisp2@gmail.com"
password --> "q"
__________________________________________________________________

Thanks!
WdeM

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. We take security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this bug until we have determined a potential patch.
 
Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster.

PS: The reason why this is a problem is because the whole point of disallowing weak password usage, is to keep users data safe. If this little restriction is missing, will everything else be meaningless.
In example, if you have gate that is suppose to keep unauthorized people out. The gate is totally bulletproof and just simply unbreakable. Good, but what if the lock of the gate is like a kids toy and anyone can break it. Well, everything else just went meaningless.
And even if I think that it's everyone's own responsibility to use complex passwords, you can not just hope that everyone understands the meaning of a good password.

Thanks!
WdeM

Do you agree with me that this is a problem?

Thanks!
Walentin

Hi!

Are you still accepting reports?

Thanks!
WdeM

Nice catch! We have confirmed this vulnerability and have escalated this internally.

We will now proceed as following:

1. Work on a patch and send it back to you to request it for verification
2. Validate the impact and determine a potential bounty payout
3. Release an advisory and an update

Sounds good.

Thanks!
Walentin

Hi!

What is the current situation with this one, if you don't mind me asking? :)

Thanks!
Walentin

Hi again and Happy New Year!

I really do appreciate any updates, concerning this issue! :)

Thanks!
Walentin | WdeM
I'm chasing up to find out.

Hi!

The issue seems to be resolved!

Walentin
I didn't think that it was, yet. What's changed your opinion?

Hi!

I apologise. I remembered incorrectly what the original issue was. I tried changing my password using forgot password function. The problem occurs when you change your password after you have logged in. My bad.

Thanks!
Walentin

But now when we are in the subject, is there any updates concerning this issue? 
Should not be such a big thing to fix :)

Thanks!
WdeM
Thanks for the clarification @wdem. At this stage, I don't have an timeline on when it should be fixed.

Understood, no problem.

Thanks!
Walentin

Thanks for updating to the correct scope.
Walentin

Hi!

Could you give me some insights concerning this report. Would you evaluate these types of issues low or very low? 

Thanks!
Walentin
At this point, I'm still investigating. I'm leaving the severity at low.

Thanks for the update.
Walentin

@wdem, I don't believe that password policies are available by default. However, if you install [the Security app](https://marketplace.owncloud.com/apps/security), available for free, then you can do so. Does this solve your issue?

Hi!

I'm not sure what you mean with password policies are not available by default, but it seems that the original flaw is fixed. I'm not able to change my password in the form that doesn't match with the required password policies. 

So in simple terms, this issue is resolved from my point of view.

Thanks!
WdeM
Ok, thanks for the clarification. Do you want some swag?

Hi!

If this is not worthy of a bounty, then swag sounds good.

Thanks!
Walentin
Excellent. If you email love@owncloud.com, they'll sort you out.
Thanks for raising the report. Please let me know if there's anything else on this topic.

Could we disclose this one?

Thanks!
WdeM

Could we change the status to resolved, since we agreed that there was a problem and you solved the problem?
I feel that Informative seems little off here.

Thanks!
WdeM
Sound fair. I'll do that now.

Thanks!
WdeM
@wdem, can you remove the request to disclose publicly? It will be done, but not until a bit longer into the current release.

Hi!

Sorry, It's not possible from my side. You can probably decline the offer somehow?

Thanks!
WdeM
Thanks for the rapid feedback.
